Cassie Parsons

Gameplay Programmer, Version Control Admin, Sword Fighter

About Me

I am a games programmer with an interest in writing games systems that are designed to be flexible and easy to use, both by programmers and non-programmers
My skills include:

  • Unity
  • C#
  • C++
  • Java
  • DirectX 11
  • Open GL 4.5
  • SFML

Elusive Core: Zero Trace

Elusive Core: Zero Trace was a game I worked on with a team of 8 other students during my third year of Abertay University,the game was a success but we had further things we wanted to do with the game, and so we decided to take it to dare, where we made it to the finalists,during development, I was one of 2 programmers, with my ain area of focus being systems and tools for our level designer to create levels, one system of note is the spotlight system, since the final concept of the levels wasn't fully realized, I needed to make the spotlight behaviour as open to our designer without them needing me to code it's behaviour. To achieve this, I created a system of anchors and triggers, where any trigger could tell the spotlight to move to any anchor, there were several types of trigger and anchor, and if our designer wanted a new type of trigger or anchor, it could be easily added and integrated into the system. As well as this, I was our teams version control admin, during Dare, I set up our team to work during the git-flow workflow, which was a success, with some improvements to be taken from it. The experience gave me opportunity to get a lot more comfortable working with git, using functions like cherry-pick, rebasing and even writing a couple python scripts to automate certain tasks
